channel.title: NEJM This Week - Audio Summaries
channel.description: The New England Journal of Medicine (NEJM) Weekly Audio Summary RSS feed. NEJM (http://www.nejm.org) is a weekly general medical journal that publishes new medical research findings, review articles, and editorial opinion on a wide variety of topics of importance to biomedical science and clinical practice.
channel.itunes:author: The New England Journal of Medicine

item.title: NEJM This Week - June 7, 2012
item.description: This summary covers the issue of June 7, 2012. Featured are articles on delamanid for patients with MDR pulmonary tuberculosis, a national survey of drug-resistant tuberculosis in China, vismodegib in basal-cell cancer, and combination chemotherapy in advanced adrenocortical carcinoma; review articles on acute limb ischemia and on 200 years of cancer research; a Clinical Problem-Solving article on the wolf at the door; and Perspective articles on emergency departments, Medicaid costs, and access; on a primary care update; and on 200 years of hospital costs and mortality.
item.itunes:keywords: medicine, doctor, physician, primary care, clinical practice

item.title: NEJM This Week - May 31, 2012
item.description: This summary covers the issue of May 31, 2012. Featured are articles on DrotAA in adults with septic shock; salmonellosis and live, mail-order poultry; preoperative chemoradiotherapy for esophageal cancer; childhood outcomes after hypothermia for encephalopathy; nighttime intensivist ICU staffing and mortality; and protein templating and dementia; a review article on drowning; a case report of a man with visual-field loss and a mass in the brain; and Perspective articles on undocumented persons and the ACA, on palliation for dying undocumented immigrants, and on bisphosphonates for osteoporosis.
item.itunes:keywords: medicine, doctor, physician, primary care, clinical practice

item.title: NEJM This Week - May 24, 2012
item.description: This summary covers the issue of May 24, 2012. Featured are articles on aspirin for preventing the recurrence of venous thromboembolism; prednisone, azathioprine, and N-acetylcysteine for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis; estrogen and pseudomonas exacerbations in cystic fibrosis; urodynamic tests before stress-incontinence surgery; and effectiveness of long-acting reversible contraception; a review article on an anti-CD20 antibody for B-cell lymphomas; a case report of a woman with HER2-positive breast cancer; and Perspective articles on the ethics of waste avoidance, on beyond the "R word", on performance improvement in health care, and on sharing the care to improve access to primary care.
item.itunes:keywords: medicine, doctor, physician, primary care, clinical practice

item.title: NEJM This Week - May 17, 2012
item.description: This summary covers the issue of May 17, 2012. Featured are articles on warfarin versus aspirin in heart failure, natalizumab and risk of progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy, azithromycin and the risk of cardiovascular death, coffee drinking and mortality, STAT3 mutations in T-cell large granular lymphocytic leukemia, and stem cells and spinal cord repair; a review article on secondary prevention after ischemic stroke or transient ischemic attack; a case report of a woman with diplopia, headaches, and papilledema; and Perspective articles on the evolving primary care physician, on a comprehensive evaluation or checklist for mental illness, and on grief, depression, and the DSM-5.
item.itunes:keywords: medicine, doctor, physician, primary care, clinical practice
